group_works.title: Capitalism
group_works.creator_credit: Yves Gerard Issembert, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society

results.title: Capitalism
results.creator_credit: Yves Gerard Issembert, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Capitalism, socialism, communism”.
A general introduction to capitalist economies. The video traces the development of the market economy in late 17th Century Britain, where colonial expansion and the beginning of industrialisation saw the rise of the merchant and labouring classes. The video offers an introduction to the “laissez-faire” economic theories of Adam Smith which argue for a completely deregulated market with no government intervention. The experience of the Great Depression, however, is highlighted to indicate the limits to deregulation and to explore the tension in capitalist societies between satisfying the needs of the market and the needs of human beings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yves Gerard Issembert, Sidney Platt and National Geographic Society

results.title: Canoeing safely
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Underlines some of the dangers which abound on almost every river and canal and shows ways of taking sensible precautions to avoid these dangers. Topics covered include life; hazards; paddling skills; an ‘H’ rescue; canoe buoyancy aids; weirs; capsize drill; stopper waves; emergency packs; bridges and a ‘T’ rescue.

results.title: Basic strokes
results.creator_credit: Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Shot in both still and fast moving water, shows all the simple skills needed to paddle a canoe. Shows forward strokes, sculling draw, slap support, sculling for support, reverse paddle, sweep stroke, draw stroke, low telemark and hanging draw.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Explorer Films

results.title: Making a canoe
results.creator_credit: Peter Halket, Maurice Dybeck and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Two boys, with the help of an adult instructor, make a slalom canoe from glass reinforced plastic. The processes involved are shown step by step. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: First time afloat
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Intended for the complete newcomer to canoeing, this films shows the importance of never canoeing without a lifejacket. Shows methods of getting afloat, simple paddling strokes, and how to choose a route. Also shows how easy it is to escape from a capsize, and deals with how to land both canoeist and canoe. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films

results.title: Police
results.creator_credit: Terence Macartney-Filgate, Wolf Koenig, Roman Kroitor and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Candid eye”.
The misbehaving public performs for the camera in a half-hour miscellany of misdeeds. In a behind-the-scenes look at the hour-by-hour operation of a large metropolitan police force, this film presents a fair sampling of what keeps Toronto’s police officers busy
